title: A regular person’s guide to the mind-blowing world of hybrid quantum computing
content:
Stephen Hawking once suggested Albert Einstein’s assertion that “God does not play dice” with the universe was wrong. In Hawking’s view, the discovery of black hole physics confirmed that not only did God play dice, “but that he sometimes confuses us by throwing them where they can’t be seen.” Are we here by chance or design? A more pragmatic approach to the question, considering the subject matter, would be to assume that all answers are correct. In fact, that’s the basis of quantum physics. Here’s the simplest explanation of how it all works that you’ll ever read: imagine flipping a…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: You don't need to be a physicist to care about the wacky world of physics. The future is quantum, here's what you need to know now.
